Analysis.name: Symptomatic VTE: short-term (45 days or fewer); COVID-19 sensitivity analysis
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk
The allocation sequence was random. The allocation sequence was adequately concealed. Any baseline differences observed between intervention groups appear to be compatible with chance.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk

Participants, caregivers and people delivering the interventions were unaware of intervention groups during the trial. An appropriate analysis was used to estimate the effect of assignment to intervention.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Outcome data were available for nearly all randomized participants.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: The method of measuring the outcome was not inappropriate. The measurement or ascertainment of the outcome did not differ between intervention groups. The outcome assessors were unaware of the intervention received by study participants.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: The data were analyzed in accordance with a pre-specified plan that was finalized before unblinded outcome data were available for analysis. The result being assessed is unlikely to have been selected, on the basis of the results, from multiple eligible outcome measurements within the outcome domain. Reported outcome data are unlikely to have been selected, on the basis of the results, from multiple eligible analyses of the data.
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to be at low risk of bias for all domains for this result.

Analysis.name: Symptomatic VTE: short-term (45 days or fewer); COVID-19 sensitivity analysis
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk
"Randomization was computer-generated. Allocation was centralized (telephone interactive voice-response system)"
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
"patients were randomly assigned in 1:1 ratio in a double-blind manner" Intention to treat analysis was used.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: bilateral compression ultrasonography was used to evaluate patients with suspected DVT and outcome assessors were blinded to treatment groups
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to be at low risk of bias for all domains for this result.

Analysis.name: Major bleeding: short-term (45 days or fewer); same extended agent sensitivity analysis
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk
Randomisation was done in permuted blocks of variable size, using a central, concealed, web-based, automated randomisation system
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk

Participants, carers or people delivering the interventions were aware of intervention groups during the trial AND No deviations from intended intervention arose because of the trial context. An appropriate analysis was used to estimate effect of assignment to intervention
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Outcome data were available for all, or nearly all, randomized participants
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: The method of measuring the outcome was not inappropriate. The measurement or ascertainment of the outcome did not differ between intervention groups. The outcome assessors were unaware of the intervention received by study participants
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: The data were analyzed in accordance with a pre-specified plan that was finalized before unblinded outcome data were available for analysis. The result being assessed is unlikely to have been selected, on the basis of the results, from multiple eligible outcome measurements within the outcome domain. Reported outcome data are unlikely to have been selected, on the basis of the results, from multiple eligible analyses of the data.
Overall.bias.support: The study is judged to be at low risk of bias for all domains for this result
